content.title: Iliofemoral Bypass
content.definition: A surgical bypass from the iliac artery to the femoral artery, used for unilateral iliac occlusive disease when the contralateral iliac system is unsuitable for crossover bypass.

clinical_features.unilateral: Unilateral iliac occlusion with good contralateral iliac
clinical_features.aortobifemoral: Less morbid alternative to aortobifemoral in select cases
clinical_features.limb_threat: Critical limb ischemia with iliac disease

clinical_features.inflow: Common or external iliac artery above disease
clinical_features.outflow: Common femoral artery or profunda if CFA diseased
clinical_features.ureter: Avoid injury to ureter crossing iliac vessels

clinical_features.exposure: Retroperitoneal approach for iliac, vertical groin incision
clinical_features.distal: End-to-side to CFA, may include profundaplasty
clinical_features.tunnel: Create tunnel anterior to iliac vein

clinical_features.complications: Lymphatic leak, wound infection, graft infection

clinical_features.comparison: Similar patency to aortobifemoral for unilateral disease
clinical_features.advantage: Avoids aortic cross-clamp and bilateral dissection

sources.reference: Defined Defined Defined Defined J Vasc Surg. 2007;45:S5A-S67A
Defined Defined Defined Defined Eur J Vasc Endovasc Surg. 2017;53:445-453
